intro: Cybianthus oblongifolius, commonly known as the narrow-leaf cybianthus, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is characterized by its elongated, narrow leaves and clusters of small, yellowish-orange flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is often found in arid or semi-arid environments. It is a member of the Apiaceae family, which includes parsley and carrots, and is known for its aromatic properties. Cybianthus oblongifolius is often used in local landscaping due to its drought tolerance and ornamental value.
